definition: to seize total victory (idiom); an overwhelming victory/to win by a landslide (in election)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to catch/to obtain/to capture
to reap/to harvest
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: Bart really cleaned up in the card game.
sentences.chinese: 巴特在纸牌有戏中大获全胜。

sentences.english: Pat was concerned winning it all would make us too comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 帕特担心大获全胜会使我们太过惬意放松。

sentences.english: After doing this for several months, I scored a date with one of them.
sentences.chinese: 连续干了几个月，我终于大获全胜，跟一个男生约会。

sentences.english: Mahathir. Pakatan Rakyat candidates, as expected, emerged triumphant and completely unscathed .
sentences.chinese: 一如所料，民联候选人大获全胜。

sentences.english: They're looking for a walk-off grand slam when the game has just begun.
sentences.chinese: 他们总希望比赛一开场就能大获全胜。

sentences.english: Speeding off in a stolen car, the thief thinks he has got a great catch.
sentences.chinese: 超速驾驶在偷来的汽车里，偷车贼以为自己大获全胜。

sentences.english: We played mah-jong last night and I swept the board.
sentences.chinese: 我们昨夜打麻将牌，我大获全胜。

sentences.english: Indeed, Buffett can win the game before ever stepping up to bat.
sentences.chinese: 的确，巴菲特不费吹灰之力就能在交易中大获全胜。

sentences.english: By contrast, Senator Dole won big.
sentences.chinese: 相反，多尔参议员大获全胜。

sentences.english: Some people thought after winning it all last year you'd put on a few more pounds in the off-season .
sentences.chinese: 有些人觉得在去年大获全胜之后你在休赛期又养膘了。

definition: to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
total defeat of an army (idiom); fig. a complete wipeout
to triumph over an opponent
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to fight with all one's might
to lose a war
to defeat/to smash/to rout
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to win/to be victorious/to report a victory
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
utterly defeated
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
